snippet: The service’s board of governors said it had come to the decision after Congress passed a measure in March requiring it to continue delivering mail six days a week.
abstract: Postal Service's Board of Governors backs away from its plan to stop Saturday mail delivery, criticizing Congress for taking cost-cutting proposal off the table.
lead_paragraph: The service’s board of governors said it had come to the decision after Congress passed a measure in March requiring it to continue delivering mail six days a week.

headline.seo: Postal Service Halts Push to Limit Saturday Service
headline.main: Postal Service Halts Push to End Delivery of Mail on Saturdays
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Halts Push to End The Delivery of Mail on Saturdays
